summary: Constance C. Smith was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents available are payroll and certification reports, indicating her employment with the committee. These documents list her name, and in some cases, her salary and social security number. The reports span from April 1978 to December 1978, suggesting her employment lasted at least that long. The documents do not provide specific details about her role within the committee.
significance: Constance C. Smith's significance lies in her employment with the Select Committee on Assassinations. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed in these documents, her presence on the payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's work related to the JFK assassination investigation.
